message_1: A triangle in hyperbolic geometry has angles of 80 degrees, 70 degrees, and 30 degrees. Determine the hyperbolic area of the triangle.
message_2:
In hyperbolic geometry, the area of a triangle can be determined using the Gauss-Bonnet theorem. The formula for the area of a hyperbolic triangle with angles α, β, and γ is:

Area = π - (α + β + γ)

First, we need to convert the angles from degrees to radians:

80 degrees = 80 * (π/180) = 4π/9 radians
70 degrees = 70 * (π/180) = 7π/18 radians
30 degrees = 30 * (π/180) = π/6 radians

Now, we can plug these values into the formula:

Area = π - (4π/9 + 7π/18 + π/6)
Area = π - (8π/18 + 7π/18 + 3π/18)
Area = π - (18π/18)
Area = π - π
Area = 0

The hyperbolic area of the triangle is 0.
